schema.name: Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, which takes about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Crack the eggs into a bowl, add salt, black pepper, and dried rosemary. Whisk until well combined.
Heat a large skillet or wok over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon of oil.
Add the minced garlic to the skillet and saut√© until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and stir gently until the eggs are softly set, about 3 minutes.
Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the skillet with the eggs. Stir and toss gently, breaking up the eggs and mixing them well with the rice. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Season the fried rice with additional salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

schema.description: Dive into a plate of Egg Garlic Adlai Fried Rice, tailored to suit your health-centric lifestyle. Meticulously selected for those who prefer low-sugar and nutritious meals, this recipe transforms simple ingredients into a delightful fusion of flavors and textures. A perfect embodiment of 'healthy eating without sacrificing taste', it's crafted for those who seek to maintain a balanced diet while indulging in the pleasures of home-cooked comfort food.
